Legacy Document

Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Inside Macintosh: Interapplication Communication /
Chapter 12 - Data Access Manager / Creating a Query Document

Query Records and Query Resources

The DBGetNewQuery function converts the 'qrsc' resource in the query document into a query record in memory. The query definition function can then modify the query record before the application sends the query to the data server. See
"The Query Record" beginning on page 12-57 for a description of the query record. See "The Query Resource" beginning on page 12-91 for the format of a 'qrsc' resource. The next section provides information about query definition functions.
